Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is speckled with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip, with one line of cord-marked decoration and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.187)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36441) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36441)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 299 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13487 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
